verses.name: Remains: Quadratus, Bishop of Athens 1:4
verses.text: Quadratus is spoken of by Eusebius as a "man of understanding and of Apostolic faith".

verses.name: Remains: Quadratus, Bishop of Athens 1:5
verses.text: And he celebrates Aristides as a man of similar character.

verses.name: Remains: Quadratus, Bishop of Athens 1:6
verses.text: These were the earliest apologists; both addressed their writings to Hadrian, and they were extant and valued in the churches in the time of Eusebius.

verses.name: Remains: Quadratus, Bishop of Athens 1:7
verses.text: From the Apology for the Christian Religion.

verses.name: Remains: Quadratus, Bishop of Athens 1:8
verses.text: Our Saviour's works, moreover, were always present:  for they were real, consisting of those who had been healed of their diseases, those who had been raised from the dead; who were not only seen whilst they were being healed and raised up, but were afterwards constantly present.

verses.name: Remains: Quadratus, Bishop of Athens 1:9
verses.text: Nor did they remain only during the sojourn of the Saviour on earth, but also a considerable time after His departure; and, indeed, some of them have survived even down to our own times.
